author: Stuart Brennan
title: Man City's Yaya Toure talks Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane's devastating potential
text:
Sport Man City's Yaya Toure talks Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane's devastating potential Manchester City midfielder claims Pep Guardiola is fashioning his youngsters into a force to take on the best on the planet Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester City FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling are turning into world-class stars under the watchful eye of Pep Guardiola . 
And Manchester City midfielder Yaya Toure believes that the pace of those two wide men could propel the Blues into the Champions League quarter-final. 
City face Monaco in the first leg of their last 16 tie and – even though they will be missing the third part of their exciting trio with Gabriel Jesus injured – Toure says they could be the key. 
“If you look at Raheem or Sané, they’re so quick, so quick,” Toure told BT Sport in an interview to be screened ahead of the game. 
“To be honest especially counter-attack, we can manage well the ball, control the ball. They can diversify the team so well when counter-attacking. So quick with the ball, without the ball. Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling have struck up a friendship - and Yaya Toure thinks they could terrorise defences for City for years to come 
“Raheem with the ball, without the ball. Gabriel Jesus and Sergio Aguero the same, with the ball, without the ball. I think this year, they’re younger and very, very fast.” 
Sterling has been transformed under Guardiola, after Manuel Pellegrini tried to get him to fit into his one-touch, two-touch style of playing. 
From day one Guardiola told the England winger that he wanted him to get on the ball and run at defenders. 
And that has made Sterling a disruptive attacking force, even if his end product still requires some polish. Raheem Sterling has caused defences serious problems this season 
Toure says that will come for the 22-year-old and for 21-year-old Sane. 
Asked if they could be world-class, Toure said: “I think so. For them to participate in Champions League, to be able to play against big defenders, they’re going to learn more. 
“Those guys can make any defence, even in Premier League or Europa or Champions League, they can make them suffer. 
“In training sometimes when Sane or Raheem take me, it’s so difficult. They’re quick, they’re sharp. When you see them they’re hungry, they push them. Push them. 
“I think you can see, when you compare Raheem from last year to this year, I see a massive change.” Leroy Sane has looked like a quality player since he returned from injury last month 
Is that down to Guardiola? “To be honest, yeah,” said Toure 
“Because now Raheem is full of confidence, playing clearly, his feet, he’s good and always up there – always the same pace. 
“Unbelievable, you see Sané as well, playing brilliant as well. I think our strikers are fantastic, fantastic.” 
Toure, playing against one of his former clubs, also feels that City's style might be more suited to success in Europe, with the Blues trailing behind Chelsea in the Premer League. Read More Comparing Man City to Manchester United and Liverpool is unfair says Kevin De Bruyne 
“We can do it because the way we play, the style we play with a new manager, we are a very open team, play tactical football, we want to dominate the opponent. If we all chase and focus on goal, we can do it.” BT Sport is your home of unmissable live football.
